data.title: Unwanted Transparency
data.body:
Hello!
We've noticed that every single sprite in our sprite batch is transparent, but we are pretty sure that every asset we use isn't. I don't have any screen shots atm, but will upload as soon as possible, but I've heard that this is a know bug not related to libgdx?

Where should I file this bug report?

Cheers!

data.title: Use robovm plugin 0.0.8, resolve #1813
data.body:
- Updates to use the new RoboVM gradle plugin that uses RoboVM 0.0.12
- Allows you to have an empty text field in the android sdk text box if you don't have the android module selected

data.title: New gdx-setup.jar demands an Android SDK path, even when not targetting Android
Added support for progressive JPEG
data.body:
Using the public domain JPGD, JPEG decompressor which can be found here: https://code.google.com/p/jpeg-compressor/

I've added an unsupported_format function to stb_image, which informs gdx2d to use JPGD in case it has returned 1. A wrapper class jpgd_c.h/cpp was created to allow C access of the namespaced jpgd::decompress_jpeg_image_from_memory method (If there is a simpler approach, please let me know). I also added a custom failure_reason method (similar to stb_image) to give more explanation why it failed.
It supports greyscale, RGB and RGBA format. However currently it seems to only give the correct image if 3 byte/px (RGB888) are requested. Maybe someone knows how to fix this?

I tested it on desktop (Mac64, Linux32) and iOS and it works as expected.

data.title: 1.0.1 Release. Robovm 0.0.12, update libgdx versions
data.body:
Update versions in the gradle setup
- Robovm 0.0.12
- Add Libgdx 1.0.1 in version choice

data.title: Add centering methods for Sprite.java
data.body: Some times (or at least I prefer doing so) it is better to place a Sprite by specifying where its center should be, rather then its lower left corner.

data.title: Methods to enable averaging multiple transform matrices
data.body:
I wrote some methods to enable weighted averaging of multiple transform matrices in order to obtain a transform which is the "weighted midway" between the given transforms. To achieve this, translations are lerped and rotations are slerped. By definition, more than two Quaternions are slerped by:

```
(q_1^w_1)*(q_2^w_2)* ... *(q_n^w_n)
```

where `w_i` sum to 1. This is particularly useful when transform information from multiple observers must be combined into a single one.

data.title: PolygonSprite.draw(PolygonSpriteBatch) misses triangles after first polygon
data.body:
I got something like this 
http://clip2net.com/clip/m83892/1399384291-clip-5kb.jpg
First polygon always ok. If I call flush() after each polygon, everything works properly. 
I have tested on both 1.0.0 and 1.0.1-SNAPSHOT versions.

data.title: Add option to generate IDE project from setup UI
data.body:
Makes it easier fot newcomers, no need to install an additional plugin in Eclipse, faster compiles in Idea/Netbeans.

Need to redo the videos and think about how we treat the IDE files with respect to SCM

data.title: setInputProcessor missing in box2D tests?
data.body:
I have experimented with box2D tests and there is no input handling in those tests e.g. in ApplyForce.java no action is triggered after key pressed. 

I added Gdx.input.setInputProcessor(this); in create() method of Box2DTest.java which set up the InputProcessor and now all tests and examples for subclasses work fine and there is input handling.

data.title: FEATURE REQUEST - Read BVH motion capture files for 2D/3D use
data.body:
Hello!

It would be great if LibGDX could read BVH motion capture files and map these to a 2D spine model or a 3D model in the new 3D api. It would not be too much work I think as the bvh file format is a nice fit with Spine's joint structure.

It would really, REALLY improve the types of animations that would be possible to make in LibGDX.

data.title: Table.add() methods should return generic Cell type
data.body:
In the `scene2d.ui.Table` class, the `add()` methods return a `Cell` with no generic type information. The `BaseTableLayout.add()` methods already return a `Cell<C>` with whatever widget type you just added, so it would be nice if the `Table` also exposed that.
I'd particularly like to be able to do this:

```
Label scoreLabel = table.add("Bob's score").getWidget();
```

data.title: Issue of overlapped transitions in 3D animation
data.body:
There is an issue with overlapped transitions in 3d model animations.

It happens when:
1. ModelInstance is under animation1
2. We call controller.animate("animation2", 1f) with a transition time of 1 sec.
3. We call again controller.animate("animation2", 1f) BEFORE the first transition is finished, 

The result is that the model becomes strangelly distorsed for the whole duration of last animation. It happens not for all models (but is 100% reprodusable for some models). It seems that is somehow related to #1351. Like some bones are used in step 1, and thay are not used in steps 2 and 3. But after applying it twice withing transition times that bones do not reset to the original state.

I can not get a simple model to demonstrate the effect. Got it only on complicated work models. I could send one of them for tests privatelly, if one need.

data.title: move call to ApplicationListener#create out of didFinishLaunching so splash disappears
data.body:
Issue created per request by mzechner in [in the libgdx forum](http://badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=14031&sid=e5a0e54398cc85ed11eed851a2bbd135&p=61751#p61751) and [the robovm google group](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/robovm/PxJaHOArrNA/Jf5C3y8teMYJ):

_We can move the call to ApplicationListener#create() out of didFinishLaunching and into the render method. That way the splash screen would only last until your app gets control._

data.title: CameraMovementController for managing camera transitions
data.body:
Hi everybody,

inspired by a StackOverflow question about camera transitions I've create a "high-level" tool to control the movement of camera positions and look-at positions.

For this I've created a `CameraPath` class, which basically represents a spline with additional parameters to hold the state of the movement as well as how to move it. Also, I've written a `CameraMovementController`, which can be used to control the paths and run the transition animations.

A `Camera` instance can be assigned with a `CameraMovementController` which then will manage the transformations.

`CameraMovementController movementController = new CameraMovementController(camera);`

 A `CameraMovementController` will hold up to two `CameraPath` objects, one for animating the camera position and one for animating the lookAt position of that camera. To do so, the controller needs to be updated on each `render()` call:

`movementController.update(Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTime());`

Currently, this allows arbitrary open or close-looped smooth paths which also allow looping a given number of times or infinitely. Also, through simply not assigning a `positionPath` or `lookAtPath` to the controller, it's possible to limit the movement on just animating the position around a fixed lookAt point or changing the lookAt position, but leaving the camera position constant. 

Also, a `CameraPath` can be set to use a constant speed instead of the speed that results from the parametrization of the curve it travels along. For starting the animation of the camera position, you simply have to call the `start(...)` method on the CameraPath:

`movementController.positionPath.start(20.0f, -1, true);`
(This will start the animation of the camera position with a duration of 20 seconds for the movement, infinite looping and using a constant speed)

For demonstrating the function of the classes, I've created a new test, which basically extends the Basic3dSceneTest by animating the camera along a path.

![cameramovementcontrollertest](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5558920/2870071/64312e8a-d2a9-11e3-96f1-dfcf24f4de31.png)

When using more than one camera, the `CameraMovementController` also provides a `debugDraw(Camera)` method that uses a `ShapeRenderer` to render the paths of that controller from the view of the passed `debugCamera`. As it can be seen in the new test, this allows using some kind of overview-camera to visualize the paths of the camera.

I hope you like this little enhancement. I'm sure there are some users for this, since the 3D api is getting used more and more recently. Also, I'd be happy to write a wiki entry about how to use it, if it gets merged...

data.title: gdx-video
data.body:
Introduces a video rendering extension that works for desktop and android. It provides fullscreen Viewport driven rendering, as well as rendering to a custom Camera & Mesh.

The library currently does not yet support ios and gwt. 

On android, all video formats that android supports are supported as the MediaPlayer implementation is used. 
On desktop, ffmpeg is used, and to prevent licensing problems, we only compile with theora video support. However, this can be changed easily by changing the ffmpeg lib that is used.

During the move to a libgdx extension, we encountered several problems:

Our primary problem is that the current library loader expects a convention for naming (no version numbers, -x64). This coupled with the fact that Windows does not allow the renaming of files of compiled libraries produces some headaches when dealing with external libraries on which we have no control of the build file. To solve this problem, we introduced the SharedLibraryFinder. We place the natives jar inside the classpath (instead of the contents), and read its known location. We can iterate through the files, and regex match for the library.

If we use the build system that libgdx has, the contents of the natives jar are added directly to the classpath, which isn't iterable. A solution to this problem would be to allow iteration of (a specific part of) the classpath, as discussed in issue #1375.

Another question, is how to actually integrate the ffmpeg libs. To our understanding, there are 3 possible solutions:
- Building ffmpeg from (downloaded) source during a build.
- Building ffmpeg once on the server, and reusing it.
- Having precompiled binaries inside of the repo (bad solution).
  Currently, we use the third internally. We are currently heading for the second option, since compiling ffmpeg from scratch every build, will add a significant amount of time to the compile.

data.title: Robovm OpenAL sounds not playing properly after resume
data.body:
Hi Team,

My game does not seem to play any sound if I pause the game (home button), then open another game (like Hearthstone), then resuming the already started game. But if I do not open another game while on the homescreen, sounds play normally. This also happens sometimes after pause and resuming several times in a row.

Music runs fine though, but cuts of after a while, I'm using a mixture of WAV and MP3 formats.

But if I pause and resume the game a couple times more, all the sounds that should be playing previously now plays immediately the moment the game is resumed. It is as if the audio thread did not resume properly the previous times.

My setup is latest nightlies with latest robovm 0.11. With iPad Mini first gen, iOS 7.1.1

data.title: Robovm Black screen after resume
data.body:
Hi LibGDX team, 

My game works fine but when resuming after a long period of time (couple of hours), the screen appears black but the game continues to run with sound. This also happens sometimes if you pause the game (home button), play another game and then resuming your game.

I'm currently using latest nightlies with latest robovm 0.11, test device is iPad Mini first gen, iOS 7.1.1

data.title: BitmapFont.setColor doesn´t seem to work on the last nightlybuild 20140430
data.body:
I am using the following code to change my bitmap color for a my bitmap font:

`generator2 = new FreeTypeFontGenerator(Gdx.files.internal("Roboto-Bold.ttf"));`
`BitmapFont fontTile = generator2.generateFont((int) (55 * scale));`
`fontTile.setColor(Color.valueOf("776E65FF"));`

But setColor doesn´t seem to work since my font remains with white color always! 

Funny thing if i create a labelstyle and apply my color like this:

`LabelStyle labelStyleTitle = new LabelStyle(fontTitle,Color.valueOf("776E65FF"));` 

It starts working, but i need to change the font color of my TextButton what should i do?

data.title: add mirrors options in gdx-setup
data.body:
gdx-setup is very useful tool but It is heavily dependent on [gradle distribution](http://services.gradle.org/) and `mavenCentral`.

In fact,you know,the network in some country is not 'free' and fast,so it's hard to use gdx-setup and powerful gradle.

I'm a developer in china,in order to use this tool,i use maven mirrors in china and use local gradle not gradle wrapper.It works well.

I think maybe we can add some options in gdx-setup,such as use maven mirror not `mavenCentral`;use local gradle not gradle wrapper.

In this way,more people can enjoy new libgdx and gradle tool.

And now most of us in china use ·gdx-setup-ui· or modify `build.gradle` manually.

data.title: Add to methods to get the max font size from height and width constraints
data.body:
Return the FreeTypeFontParameter#size that ensure that n chars will fit inside the given width and/or the given bounds... Methods are named similar to scaleForPixelHeight() :
- scaleForPixelWidth
- scaleToFitSquare

data.title: fix issue 910: refresh controllers extension when window handle lost
data.body:
Fixes this bug: https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/910
The window handle gets lost on windows when full screen is toggled. This causes the controller extension to stop working. The below changes fix this issue by reloading the handle and controllers when the handle changes.

data.title: fix bug where you cannot insert at the end of a ShortArray
data.body: It seems ShortArray is the only array that doesn't let you insert at the end of the array (index = size). It seemed like a simple error, that's why I thought I was allowed to simply PR it

data.title: Problem with Pool in HTML5 version
data.body: Creating pools with Pools.get(Something.class) works fine in desktop and Android versions, but doesn't work in GWT; the normal override of newObject() works fine.

data.title: No support tif texture?
data.body: When I loading tif texture throws unknown image type

data.title: iOS Clipboard support
data.body: Added iOS clipboard support. Also ran eclipse formatter on other iOS classes and removed unnecessary FIXME's and hacks.
